column1: I got my new UN65JS8500 last Tuesday after I accidentaly broke my XBR55X850A, well accidents happens.
Anyway, Samsung's new screen panels are called SUHD.
The JS8500 includes the One Connect Mini as oppose to the 9000 series which include the One Connect Box with more input options and future proof of the hardware.
Also this set has a LED Edge-Lit backlight display as his more expensive brother the JS9000, only
the JS9500 has a Full Arrange Local Dimming capabilities that will have superior HDR performance.

And last but not least is the obvious, is not curved but Samsung was extremely wise to keep the flat version only to the US market, but all of the other great features from the 9000 series are present.
Once you properly calibrate your set be ready to be amazed.
I watched The Dark Knight, Pacific Rim and Transformers 4: Age of Extinction, three of my favorite Reference movies on Blu Ray.
The new OS is easy to navigate and use.
I considered both the JS9000 & 9500 but I'm not a fan of curved TV's.
I did way to many hours of research leaning towards discounted 2014 models as I'm basically done paying extra for being an early adopter of new technology.
In the end I just couldn't pull the trigger on settling for what my eyes perceived to be an inferior picture to the JS8500.
I needed a TV now and am willing to watch the price drop in the coming year.
If your considering this TV my recommendation is go for it!
I'll update this review after I get more time using this TV.
I've attached a photo of a youtube 4k video taken with my samsung S5 phone.
I purchased this TV about 2 weeks ago and I can't say enough good things about it.
The picture is so clear that it makes you wonder how you lived with 1080p beforehand.
But I will warn you it takes some time of working through all of its features before you get this picture.
If you have a Xbox One or PS4 you will see a drastic difference as well.
I play Destiny on Xbox One and it looks amazing.
One thing you will have to do with FPS or action games is switch over to game mode every time.
Without this switch you will notice a substantial lag that will make for a not so pleasant gaming experience.
Once you switch over to game mode though it looks amazing.

I did an awful lot of research before buying a TV in this price range and through all my reading I saw that Hight Dynamic Range (HDR) was extremely important to future proof your investment and this TV has it.
The other model I looked very closely at was the new Sony model in the same 55 inch set.
Both had amazing picture but the HDR coupled with the slightly better picture in my opinion I chose this model.
I know many people say there isn't much 4K content out right now and that is fairly true.
But I have watched a fair number or blu rays the past two weeks and they look stunning.
I turned on the UHD upscale and it creates a far better picture than my prior 50 inch LED 1080p TV.
One that was particularly amazing was Lucy.
The colors are so vibrant its hard to look away.
The Samsung UN65JS8500FXZA TV arrived on November 12.
They were serious flashlight issues emitting from the sides and bottom of the TV screen (see attached pictures).
This TV is an LED edge lit TV.
The edge lighting was clearly visible.
This seems to be a common problem with this model.
I've seen other people complain about this issue online.
I filed a support ticket at Samsung.com and attached the images showing the problem.
I also called Sumsung Support and referenced my online support ticket ID number.
After speaking to several people and being disconnected once, Samsung arranged to have a local authorized repair technician come to my house and replace the TV screen on November 17.
I was on the phone for a total of two hours with Samsung and their agents to get the entire problem resolved.
Now that the screen has been replaced, the TV looks great.
I am very pleased with the final result.
However, the TV screen should have worked when purchased.
I should not have to replace a brand new screen.
For that reason, I give 3 stars instead of 5.
Okay, it is now December 30, 2015.
I have owned the TV for 6 weeks now and it works flawlessly.
The best image is shown when seated directly in front of the TV.
I attached an image showing Home Alone playing on the TV.
Also, the 3D is awesome.
I didn't even buy the TV for the 3D capability.
But I am so happy I did.
You can convert any television show or movie to 3D.
It does not work on 2D cartoons, but it does work with everything else.
I am super pleased with the 3D functionality.
The UN65JS8500FXZA comes with one pair of glasses.
I bought additional open box Samsung 3D glasses online at BestBuy.com for $9.99.
Please let me know if you have any questions.
I normally look to upgrade every 2-3 years and this process is usually a very simple one - checkout the offerings from Sony & Samsung and select the best option.
But other advances in technology, both those that are here and those that are arriving soon (hopefully) made this process much more involved and a bit befuddling at times.
I'm still not all that sold on 4k but the best picture quality technologies are only available on 4k sets so you have to take a close look at what's available in this space.
And while 10-bit panels, wider color gamuts, nano-crystals/Triluminous displays, etc. are nice features, none of them would have changed my original plan for a 2014 1080P set.
What did was HDR because I believe that could be a game changer.
It also narrowed the search down to two Samsung models, the JS8500 or JS9000, and I don't think you can go wrong with either one.
The 9000 is curved and has better sound but neither of those was a concern for me.
But it also has the full OCB for better future upgradeability so that was worth considering.

But you can't upgrade the panel, so I would rather use the $500 difference in price along with the future evolution kit upgrade ($400+) and whatever you can sell the JS8500 for and put that towards a new TV when the time comes.
Anyway, it's only been a few days but so far I am extremely happy with the JS8500.
Setup was a breeze and the picture quality ranges from great to pick-your-own-superlative.
Now there are a few channels that looked better on my old TV (Samsung F6300) but they don't look that great to begin with so be prepared for a few sources that will disappoint.
I'm getting used to the remote but it is on the small side and won't be suitable for some folks.
But any of these can be easily upgraded and are not rating factors for me.
Now I'd like to mention a few setup/installation items that might save some folks a little aggravation and maybe result in more accurate reviews.
First, I did experience one issue with this set which was some flickering/flashlighting on the bottom of the screen that was very noticeable when watching movies in letterbox format.
But sometimes this is caused by the screws being over-tightened during the mfg.
process, so I loosened the 4 bottom screws by about a 1/4 turn (one needed more) and the problem has not returned.
Something to try before returning it.
Second, if you have satellite like I do (DirecTV) you should test your signal strength to make sure you don't have any issues because this can greatly impact picture quality on any set.
This is easily done under the Settings menu with DTV.
You also want to make sure the cable/satellite box is configured to allow the TV to do ALL the upscaling/processing.
With DTV this means Resolutions should all be checked with Native set to ON and screen format set to original format.
I would also recommend turning off all of the following on the TV, at least initially - Instant On/ECO settings/Smart Security/Anti-virus.
These can cause various problems with streaming, shutoffs, etc.
so try these individually after you have everything else setup/dialed in.
I know they say you shouldn't professionally calibrate it until after 100 hours so maybe this is related.
I also need to give a couple major kudos to Amazon.
First, they double boxed the shipment which is a service that some places charge $30-75 for and others don't even offer.
And second, they took care of me when Samsung not only extended the original sale past 6/13, but then included a free soundbar or 24 TV with every purchase.
Still enjoying the new TV and decided to have the set calibrated.
A lot of people have reviewed this set in detail.
Rather than repeat that, here's a few words about the One Connect Mini box that is included.
I think most people will use this TV with one or more HDMI devices -- either an A/V receiver, set top box, Blu-Ray player, etc.
After initial setup, I got a couple of messages about problems with the HDMI connections.
I think these were due to the One Connect cable being loose.
It's a tight fit, and you need to make sure it is firmly connected, with a final click.
Once I did this, I had no more such problems.
I've had the Samsung UN65JS8500 for 3 months now with no problems.
Some people have been hating on the remote.
It seems pretty intuitive.
I had an issue where none of the HDMI ports were working.

I thought maybe I would need a new one-connect box to fix this, but Samsung support (1) checked that I had the latest software, and (2) had me unplug the TV while it was ON; wait a bit, then re-plug it.
This cleared the problem.
I bought this TV knowing the issues with blue corners.
hope this helps people looking at this TV and I am happy to answer any questions you might have as it is a big investment for most and the technology can sometimes feel intimidating to some.\
Hoping I was not one of those people, I ended up with that set.
On top of that, the bottom left corner was not flush.
Contacted Samsung and they deemed it to have physical damage from shipping and refused to repair it.
I will not be buying another Samsung set.
Their customer service is beyond horrible.
They will do everything possible to deny a warranty claim.
bought this TV a month ago, and just returned it last week.
(unless they were hiding with the stand.
Lets get to the BAD part.
I can't believe that for a 2015 TV, and for this price, I would be experiencing this level of issues.
The Vizio M70-C3 i bought before this TV had way better backlight, with only 32 active LED full array zones, it out performed this samsung.
I really wanted to like this TV, as I have a 52 Samsung 7000 series from 9 years ago on the wall, and it is still a very good TV.

I can't believe these two tv's share the same tech for the most part, aside from the smart features, 3D, form factor, inch count and the nano crystals...I decided to go with the LG 65EG9600 to squash any of my gripes...and if that TV doesn't knock my socks off, I give up.
I will return it, and wait a few years.
However, it has some drawbacks that might be significant to you, and there are other televisions that are much cheaper that you might consider.
Some programs look fantastic color wise.
Lastly for the pros, this is a very good looking tv, with real metal around the bezel and stand, and if you care about looks, this is a nice plus to have in a set.
Cons: this has a very reflective screen, so if you have it in a room with lots of windows or light sources, be aware that you will see them reflected in the screen.
You can still enjoy the content, as the screen can get very bright, but if you are bothered by this be aware.
Also, this set looks weak when you move off axis, worse than others I've had.
so if you have a large room where people will be seated far off to the side, be aware, the screen gets very washed out unless you sit in front of it.
Lastly, since this is edge lit instead of back lit, black levels will not be as dark as with a back lit screen.
I find the blacks good, but not quite as good as my Vizio that is back lit.
So, overall for me this was a good purchase, but there are definitely drawbacks that might be important enough for you to not consider this.
For me, the pros outweigh the cons.
As for competition, the Vizio M series is much cheaper than this, 4k and full array back lit, with good blacks and other advantages as well.
I would check that out for sure and decide which is best for your preferences.
IMO comparable Sony's or LG's are not worth considering.
Good luck.
My 65 has a very obvious lighting glowing defect in the lower left and lower right corners when viewing light-colored content regardless of source.
Looks like many other users are reporting the same thing with recently purchased TVs.
Check out the Official JS8500 thread on AVSForum for a bunch of customer photos that highlight the issue.
I'm boxing it back up for a return.
Let me start by saying that this TV is the best TV I have ever had.
The picture quality is beyond what I expected!!!
I pick this up from Best Buy since they had there Black Friday prices available now, same as Amazon has it currently.
I can't tell you how amazed I am with TV, the black levels are great for Samsung's entry level of the SUHD brand.
I originally planed on getting the LG 65UF8600, but I seen that LG has a lot of back light bleeding issues, and doing more research, I found that it is not to future proof or HDR compatible.
Don't get me wrong, I'm a huge LG fan, my last TV before this was an 55inch LG 1080p, with this TV I have no back lighting issues.
I have only watched one 3D movie so far (Gravity), it looked amazing.

I am mad that Samsung only decided to provide one single pair of 3D glasses, provided the amount of money we are spending ($2,000+), they could at least spare another 15 or 20 bucks and provide one more pair, guess I'll be watching by myself until I get some more!!!!
I have have two Monster Black Platinum HDMI cables connected.
One to my 2014 Samsung BD-F7500 4K Up-scaling 3D Blu-Ray player, and the other to my XBox One.
These HDMI cables are the best, I highly recommend getting them, I had these for about a year now connected to my 1080p TV, and they have done wonders for the picture on that set.
The cables are about a $100 a pop (plus tax), and they are worth it.
I have one with the LED indicator ($10 more), which tells me when the signal is in SD, HD, or 4K.
I've done some calibration on my own with this TV, it doesn't need to much tuning though.
All in all great TV.
The one connect box died just over a month after purchase.
It will take samsung 5-15 business day to have a replacement box shipped to me.
If you were to order this tv directly through samsung's website, it'll ship w/in 1-3 business days, but the part that's essential to the tvs functionality takes anywhere from 5-15 business days?
This wouldn't be an issue if the tv had at least one hdmi input on the tv, but it doesn't so you're at the mercy of the one connect box.
If it fails then your brand new, expensive tv is useless until a replacement box is shipped to you.
like to be specific when I write reviews here as too often the reviews of multiple models/products get blended together.
This review is for the Samsung UN24H4000 24-Inch 720p 60Hz LED TV; Amazon ASIN: B00KSBBGA4.
I purchased this product on Sept 6, 2014.
I have only used this TV for one day and at this time only have it connected to an older digital cable box via a coax connection.
I did use the Component connections for a DVD player and the picture quality is excellent.
I will have a Mini Tivo box installed early next week and following that will have an HDMI cable tv connection.
I will update my review following that.
I now have this TV connected to a Tivo Mini and the picture quality is totally excellent.
If you are concerned about 720 vs 1080 I say don't worry.
I have a four-year-old Visio 22 1080 TV in another location and the picture from this Samsung with 720 is just as good if not better.
All of the ports are on a squarish panel on the rear of the TV and all face to the rear.

I point this out because if you plan on using a USB device (such as thumb drive) to view media, you may want to obtain a USB extension cable, because if you have the TV against a wall, or in an enclosed cabinet like I do, the rear panel may not be easily accessible.
(Note that a USB extension cable is NOT the same thing as a standard USB cable.)
Another reason I point this out is the Amazon photos for this product clearly show a side panel with HDMI and USB ports.
I am certain that the photos come from Samsung as the same photos are shown at BestBuy.Com and Beach Audio.
Both the shipping carton and the product label on the rear of the TV clearly identify this TV as a UN24H4000 model.
It appears that Samsung has revised the panel configuration of this model to match the separate UN24H4500 model.
Set up was relatively simple, with the exception of a great deal of frustration mounting the TV to its base.
This model comes with three documents: A Setup Guide; a Quick tart Guide; and a User Manual.
All three of these are fold-outs.
Even the User Manual is a fold-out, is 16 by 22 in size when opened, printed on both sides, and printed in tiny print.
Fold-outs are fine for the Setup and Quick Start guides, but I would much prefer a booklet style User Manual.
The small opening and depth of the cavity makes it very difficult to aim the small screws into the small screw holes.
I had to use an set of angled hobby tweezers, and even that wasn't easy.
A magnetic bit screwdriver would make it easier.
I read in another review here on Amazon that you must be extremely careful with configuring the TV when you first turn it on because you only get one shot at it.
That person returned the set after a botched first attempt.
I too had some difficulty with a setup selection as I did not know the difference between STD, IRC, and HRC for the cable setting.
I was easily able to totally reconfigure by pressing the Menu key, scrolling down to a gear-shaped icon, which is Plug & Play, then pressing the Enter key.
By the way, I later learned that the vast majority of cable tv provider's signal are STD.
The IRC and HRC are noise reduction signals used mostly with older cable technology.
Other reviewers have complained about the sound from this model.
Putting it up high like that is a real plus for the bedroom.
An older Visio 22 TV with a larger bezel and front mounted speakers did not fit into that space.
I use this TV in the basement with a Roku 3 while working out on my bicycle trainer.
I specifically did not want a smart TV because a lot of the research I found was that most of them are laggy and freeze up.
I also plug my headphones into the remote on the Roku 3.
I can't think of anything that I don't like about this TV.
I would definitely buy this TV again and I probably will for the cabin.
Just press a few wrong buttons and you'll figure it out.
I replaced my flip phone for a not-so-smart phone (Samsung Galaxy Centura) and I replaced my old flat screen CRT TV for this.
In both cases I'm getting way more bang for the buck.
My favorite things so far have to do with menu options.
4 stars easy.
If I rotate it both my wife and I can see it fine.
I bought this TV for my elderly dad for Christmas.
He spends a lot of time watching TV because he is differently abled and almost unable to walk.
I bought it to replace a cheap TV he bought himself when his previous TV died.
My mom doesn't like the TV noise when he's watching and she's reading in the same room, so he uses headphones.
I was shocked to learn that this TV doesn't have a headphone jack.
His illness gives him cognitive and memory issues, so he can't be going into the complex menu and clicking through an elaborate system of choices simply to switch from TV speakers to headphones.
I got him an RCA adaptor, and that doesn't work.
I got him an optical to digital converter, and though that works, he would need to go through above described complexity when he wants to use headphones.
Ditto bluetooth.
It doesn't just switch back to TV speakers when you unplug them-- and I also had to buy a headphone volume control, because when you use optical out the volume goes through full blast.
I looked into hooking it up to a surround sound system, but my parents don't want speakers all over their den.
Looked into sound bars, but sound bars don't have headphone jacks.
but honestly, my Vizio's picture quality is better.
Honestly, I don't recommend this TV for elderly people or anyone who wants to use headphones.
Too much of a pain to find something that works.
My dad is waiting for me to solve his problem, and I think the only realistic way to do that is to get him a different TV.
My mom is threatening to plug in the old one and put this one away.
Honestly I wish I'd never purchased it.
Everything met
This was gift for my sister in nursing home.
She loves it!!!
THANKS!
Bought it for my big rig and the back of the television cracked where the mounting apparatus Connect's to the TV.
I have two Samsung tv's and can't say anything bad about either.
This one arrived very quickly and my son set it up for me.
We needed a small TV for our kitchen.
this is the smallest I found with the features I wanted.
No problem getting it hooked up but Samsung helped me with the final setup.
Very kind personnel to work with
Don't trust Samsung with their smart TV's after what they have said about being careful on what you say around the TV since they listen in.
Watch TV.
One Problem I have is, the TV doesn't work correctly with my DirecTV remotes.
Samsung is one of the brands that has an issue with the power on/off along with the STB.
Have to switch to TV and hit PWR to turn the TV on/off.
Just an extra step that we Don't have to do with my other TV's.
This seems to have mixed reviews, but the negative ones did not seem to apply to me.
The feet are small and hardly visible so would be essentially 'invisible' if used.
The 'frame' around the new model is much smaller, so you could fit this in a smaller space if needed - the old one filled the space.
The picture is very sharp.
I won't balance it until its on for about 50 hours, but it looks essentially the same with the contrast down to 70%.
Would I buy this again?
Unquestionably.
I bought this TV before there was any feedback and found the negative feedback before it was delivered.
I must admit that, based on the prior feedback, I was concerned about the feet as I tried to assemble the TV.
It was a great buy and I am very pleased.
Additionally, be smart and don't be influenced by reviews from people who are not verified purchasers of the product.
Love the features, don't need a Roku now :) Very pleased with this purchase and the size is perfect for my bedroom.
Almost bought a sound bar, but for the room, I don't even need it.
This tv really puts out in sound quality and volume level!
I found pleasure with the picture/sound after changing the standard settings.
At first I didn't have volume.
But after making those adjustments and restarting the tv, volume is great.
I like that the tv is silent on power on/off, and it automatically shuts off if you don't select a function.
I enjoy the energy conservation part.
Bought a wall mount, but unless you have a brick or concrete wall, it's unable to be used, so I have to return the mount.
Great tv, and my 40 in living room is just as wonderful!
I had a replacement tv delivered due to first tv being damaged in delivery
It took a couple weeks for the damages full effect to surface.,
The first tv I couldn't get volume on the first power up.
After adjusting settings and repowering I did.,
I've had (and still have) several other Samsung TVs  and have liked them.
How can a TV be slow?
It's slow to turn on.
Remember picture tube TVs that used to take time to warm up?,
The sound quality is pretty good for a TV, and at 50% volume it's loud enough for my needs.
On the back, the TV has the following ports:
* two HDMI in ports
* ANT (TV) in
* USB 3.0
* LAN (Local Area Network)
* Digital optical audio out
I've only needed to use the HDMI port, but the audio out will be useful if I ever want to upgrade to a high quality speaker system.
Second Samsung smart TV we have bought, hooked on value!
Other one larger, but same features.
Will buy again when we are in need again
Satisfactory.
I am not real particular, just wanted a decent tv with modern features.
So far I am happy with this tv & all samsung products that I have purchased.
The tv works great!
I needed it for my office and it is just as i was hoping for
This TV is a slam dunk for the price.
I've had mine for a little over a year now and I have had no issues to report thus far.
In a nut shell, this TV has exceeded my expectations.
The smart function interface is a little sluggish but all apps seem to work flawlessly when called upon.
Ultimately, it comes down to how you intend to use this tv.
Invest in the sound bar and your TV watching experience will go from good to great.
I bought one of the lower end samsung sound bars and the thing bumps with this setup.
The only regret I have with buying this TV is not going for the model with the higher refresh rate.
I bought this tv for my son and he absolutely loves it.
Every thing else very good.
I don't have cable so since Netflix is my cable, I wish I didn't have to wait.
but can be fixed by a sound bar (for the same price of the tv) In conclusion don't by this tv.
Arrived on time ....
I bought this 32 TV for my wife and she is using this as a computer monitor
We needed a second TV
Bought as a gift.
My sister loves it!
Love the TV so much that we have bought two.
The samsang TVs are the best...
So many choices when looking to buy a new TV for my bedroom.
I started comparing TVs
But then I began to look at this LG TV more closely
And now I can say that I am not disappointed with my choice.
This TV will not disappoint
Great TV for my small living room.
very light (if you need to move it - I had a 28 Sharp TV a while back that was twice as heavy);
Pros: crystal clear picture; headphone jack - which I use a lot; easy to use settings;
And probably more that I cannot think of, and probably much more that is technical that I am not really into.
easy to install stand; speakerphones are surprisingly clear for such a small TV; three HDMI ports - using one for ROKU 2 and one for cable TV;
Cons: none that I have noticed.
I am enclosing three pictures, though the pictures do not fully show how clear the TV picture is.
Highly recommended for small spaces.
One reason I purchased this product was that the stand in the middle of the TV offers a small footprint vice the newer TVs with two stands located on each end.
I purchased a table (also from Amazon) with a 12 X 24 inch top.
The table might be able to support the weight of a truck but I would need a larger table to place a two stand version TV on top of.
This LG product is sturdy and offers a great picture with just a standard coaxial cable and non HDTV cable box.
Purchased this TV from Amazon, as usual good delivery service.
Bought this to replace the bedroom TV that died.
Now that I have calibrated this set the picture rates as excellent.
The one problem I have is not with the TV but with DirectTV.
There are no control codes for this set for the DirectTV remote so you must use two remotes if you want to connect this set to DirectTV.
Good value for money.
Image quality is good (not stellar) and built-in speakers deliver good quality sound.
Menu is quite basic.
I love it!
Everything I wanted it to be
Great!
Just what I wanted!!
I love this tv!
It only has enough for one component though.
By following the directions I was able to hook up my old nintendo 64 console to this tv but everything else has to be hdmi.
Very happy with my purchase.
As advertised.
thanks so much
Bought this as a gift for my boys to have as a little gaming tv in their bedroom.
The first one arrived on time and in great shape.
Plugged it in via HDMI to demo and pick the best picture setting.
I contacted Amazon who graciously shipped out another via 2 day shipping method which arrived on a Saturday.
Quickly repacked the old TV for shipping and set up the new one.
Sure enough it has the same exact issue!
For customers reading this please note that I am no amateur and own a RCA , SHARP, VIZIO and Westinghouse TV set.
Nothing against LG and their products but this experience has definitely changed my opinion about their products.
I will be returning both defective TV's for a full refund.
Buyers beware.
Nothing special.
Got it for my elderly mother who was watching an old 24 screen in her bedroom.
This was an amazing upgrade for her :) She has to spend a lot of time in bed so this will improve her time there.
she remembers to tune into the high def channels lol.
My son loves this.
Love it.
Bought for my daughter for Xmas
If I use it while I'm on a treadmill I use closed-captions to compensate for the audio, but for normal use the set is fine.
I've had it for over three months and I'd buy it again!
My son bought this for himself.
Bought two of these in a post Black Friday sale for $98 each.
Hooked up an older Xbox 360 over component and clarity/color/etc. are all top notch
I can't comment on how long the TV will last as I have only had them for 2 weeks, but something tells me they will outlive my expectation.
Side note, the products I purchased have a different stand than the one pictured here.
I got this as a late Christmas gift.
This was a really nice purchase here at Amazon.
Picture quality is better than the 11yr old LCD TV it replaced and the sound was much better too.
Very happy with this TV and I would recommend.
I spent a great deal of time debating on what 32 TV to buy for my bedroom and did my research and this TV has been excellent.
Sound on these small TV's you cant expect a whole ton of volume but this one has plenty of volume.
looks just the same as 1080p that my sister has.
Great buy!
Absolutely so happy I went through with this buy.
Absolutely worth it I was scared of what other buyers said but I've had this t.v.
Since , the middle of February not 1 thing wrong and I leave it on ALL day literally I fall asleep to the noise of a t.v.
Did just fine.
Would buy again .
Never heard of this brand name just hoping it will hold up.
If so it will be my go to brand in the future
Bought this tv for my mom 3months ago and it's already broken.
Very disappointed!
This is day 1 with the new television.
We could not have asked for better.
Hisense makes a quality product.
I will leave a more detailed review after a few weeks of use.
I HIGHLY recommend this product!
A really great bonus!
I looked at manufacturer website and on 2016 models it says the 50 inch and above only have media player built in.
I decided to just keep it, isn't noticeable enough to me.
Perfect for my bedroom, or any room in the house!
Enough inputs for anything you need...HDMI, VGA, CABLE, ANTENNA, MHL, COMPONENT, COMPOSITE..., flexibility for anything, all for a fantastic price.
Picture great, sound exceptional for 6 speakers
My old 51" Samsung is going on 7 years without a problem, and is now in my living room to replace an LG TV I had out there
Comparing it to 4K TVs that cost three times as much, the picture is just as good for 1080p content
One slightly disappointing thing is that I have a Samsung 46" TV from 2010 that actually looks better.
I also haven't seen any TVs under $1,500 of this size that produce as good a picture.
I have another smaller Samsung that I bought about a year before this one.
The smaller Samsung has a little more function and the processors are noticeably quicker.
It honestly looks and plays better than my Samsung 27" PC Monitor.
With the older Samsung TV we never really used the smart features because it was such a pain.
Compared to the AppleTV, this has better picture quality
The sound quality is the same as the AppleTV
The LG model was cheaper than the Samsung
I decided against the Sony because of light bleed reports against the LG because it uses an IPS display while Samsung uses a VA display
To be honest I think my UN55JU7100 has a better picture.
Wasn't even as good as a curved I had in 2014.
